Package eu.unite.challenge.algorithms

Class BranchAndBoundAlgoImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.unite.challenge.algorithms.AbstractProblemSolver
      • eu.unite.challenge.algorithms.BranchAndBoundAlgoImpl
  • @Immutable
public final class BranchAndBoundAlgoImpl
extends AbstractProblemSolver
    BranchAndBoundAlgoImpl is similar to BruteForceAlgoImpl, but it uses heuristics so that only plausible solutions in the solution space are traversed. The order of traversal is also optimized. The solution space can be seen as a binary tree. For node i, the left edge denotes leaving the i+1 item, while the right edge denotes taking it. For each node, a bound is computed using the heuristic similar to { GreedyApproximationAlgoImpl} (but where we can pick a fraction of items). A subtree is pruned if
    1. It violates the weight constraint, or
    2. Its bound is less than the current maximum cost achieved by traversing other nodes of the tree

      • processChild

        private BranchAndBoundAlgoImpl.Node processChild​(BranchAndBoundAlgoImpl.Node parent,
                                                 boolean leaveChild)
        Process a child of parent. There are two possible cases:
        1. Leave child: In this case, the bound on the next level is computed using computeBound. The subtree is pruned if this bound is smaller than the bestPrice attained so far, and null is returned. Otherwise, the information related tp the item is returned as an instance of Node.
        2. Take child: In this case, we first check whether adding the child to the solution violates the weight constraint, and if so null is returned. Otherwise, the child is added, remaining weight and achieved price are updates, and the rest is as above.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent node.
        leaveChild - Whether the method should consider leaving a child.
        Returns:
        A Node to be added to search space, or null if the subtree is to be pruned.

      • computeBound

        java.math.BigDecimal computeBound​(int start,
                                  java.math.BigDecimal currentWeight)
        Compute the maximum attainable price, from this node downward. The algorithm uses a greedy heuristic, see wiki.
        Parameters:
        start - The index of the starting item.
        currentWeight - The current weight of the items in the solution subset.
        Returns:
        A bound on the maximum attainable price.
